history.content: We highly recommend all students to go to lectures because we will not webcast during the summer. The content that we will cover in this summer will be similar to past few semesters (fa15/sp16/su16/fa16/sp17). However, we might cover some new topics and skip some old topics. Based on your situation, you should at least reach out to your friends for lecture notes, especially for those lectures that you will miss. (We will try to post some notes too)

I'm enrolled in CS70 this summer, and I also have a part time internship (20 hours a week). They'd like me to come in on two days of the week for 8 hours, so I will have to miss lecture on one day every week. I was wondering if the class is still doable given this restriction and if I can use past webcasts to follow along the days I miss? And can we attend any discussion section, even if we are officially enrolled in a different one? 

On a separate note, will these webcasts (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fyEfgHHR9t0&list=PL-XXv-cvA_iD8wQm8U0gG_Z1uHjImKXFy) be taken down? I'm asking because I know that Berkeley has had to take down quite a few webcasts recently. 

Thanks!
history.subject: Missing a day of CS 70 in the summer
